The Firestone Building Products facility (Firestone) is a distribution warehouse located in Plainfield, Indiana. The warehouse handles, stores and distributes various materials for manufacture of building products, particularly insulation. No manufacturing occurs at the warehouse. The covered process will be receiving, handling, storage and loading for shipment a material named Jet Bond Spray Adhesive (Jet Bond), which is stored in small containers weighing about 45 - 48 pounds. 



Only the Jet Bond handling and storage operations (rather than full warehouse operations) were found subject to the 40 CFR 68 RMP rules due to a content of pentane above 1% and the material being rated as a National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) No. 4 flammable material (flash point < 73 ?F and initial boiling point < 100 ?F). Therefore, the entire contents of the flammable mixture in the containers are counted towards the RMP applicability threshold of 10,000 pounds, which the facility will exceed.  Based upon the offsite consequence analysis (OCA) conducted for the Jet Bond handling and storage operations and review of other applicability criteria these operations are subject to the RMP Program Level 2 requirements.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM



Firestone has developed an RMP Manual that describes and includes the management system and associated procedures and documentation related to the RMP Prevention Program Level 2 elements and Emergency Response. GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM



Firestone has developed an RMP Manual that describes and includes the management system and associated procedures and documentation related to the RMP Prevention Program Level 2 elements and Emergency Response.  This manual includes relevant Safety Information documentation and references, procedures and information for Hazard Reviews, references to the facility Standard Operating Procedures and discussion of how they are maintained, a description of Training activities and references to Training management documentation, procedures for Maintenance activities including inspection, testing and preventive maintenance instructions, procedures for Compliance Audits and references to Incident Investigation procedures the company uses.



RMP FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



At the time of this initial RMP submission, there are no RMP-related accidents to report since the material has not yet been managed onsite.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM INFORMATION



The Firestone warehouse maintains an emergency action plan which is in place to protect worker and public safety as well as the environment. The program consists of procedures for evacuating the warehouse and mak

ing notifications to appropriate emergency personnel. The overall emergency response program for the warehouse is coordinated with the Plainfield Fire Department. This coordination includes mechanisms to notify emergency responders when there is a need for a response and annual emergency response coordination activities.
